content.description: Climb a short steep move or two onto the slab. Continue up the slab and corner a short distance until you can escape up the left-facing corner.  Above the corner, a bit of easy terrain leads to a 2-bolt anchor.  One of the better routes at the Sunday Wall.
content.protection: Single rack to #3 camalot and stoppers.
content.location: Shares start with "Ritualistically Unclean" at a bit of steep rock below a slabby, left-facing corner.  Descend via anchor shared with "Bloody Sunday."

content.description:
Start left of "Sunday School" on vertical terrain.  After a couple steep moves, pass a hollow flake onto the varnish slab.  Climb the slab to the base of the overhanging head wall above.

Here a couple smaller pieces offer decent protection for the first hard move into the crack up the center of the head wall.  A #1 placed straight up into a pod protects the strenuous jams well.  An awkward stance offers a good 0.5 or 0.75 placement in the crack at the small roof.  Another strenuous move or two leads to the ledge.

Anchor opportunities are not the best on the ledge, so probably best to place a directional and belay from the bolts on "Sunday School."
content.protection: Single set of cams including small sizes, stoppers, draws/slings.  Protection is adequate but may be strenuous to place.
content.location: This line and "Sunday School" are located a short distance uphill from "Super Bowl Sunday" and "Sunday Staycation." Located just left of "Sunday School" beneath a large triangular headwall with cracks on its right side.  Descend via 2-bolt anchor atop "Sunday School."

content.description: Climb the series of flakes in the corner to a stance.  From the stance, head up and left via a short, low-angle crack.  When the crack peters out, make your way to the right on generally easy terrain and belay where convenient.  To descend, scramble right to the "Sunday School" bolts.
content.protection: Single set to #3 camalot, stoppers, slings.  Judicious use of runners will help prevent rope drag above the crack.
content.location: The leftmost route on the Sunday Wall. Shares start with "Sunday Staycation" at a series of flakes in a left-facing corner. Descend by scrambling right to 2-bolt anchor atop "Sunday School."

content.description: Climb series of flakes in left-facing corner to a stance.  From here, many variations up and right (approximately 5.7 in difficulty, but can vary depending on precise line taken) lead through cracks, bulges, and aretes.  Skirt the left side of the "Take an Atheist to Church" headwall and belay on the vegetated ledge.  To descend, scramble right to the "Sunday School" anchors.
content.protection: Single set to #3 camalot, stoppers, long runners.  Intelligent slinging around the various features will prevent rope drag.
content.location:
Shares start with "Super Bowl Sunday;" the first routes encountered on the Sunday Wall when approaching from the Ramp Routes--the leftmost lines on the wall.

Descend via scrambling to 2-bolt anchor atop "Sunday School."

content.description:
Start on the steep moves just left of the obvious, slanting chimney.  After attaining the slab, follow the left-leaning handcrack to it's terminus at a stance.  (This handcrack can be bypassed by following easy slab up left and back right to the stance, but any protection placed in this traverse would result in massive rope drag.)

From the stance, follow beautiful corner and thin-hands crack to the ledge.  Intelligent slinging early in the climb helps prevent rope drag on the upper corner.
content.protection: Single set to #3 camalot, nuts, slings.
content.location: Start at the obvious, slanting, sometimes wet chimney just uphill from "Sunday Staycation" and just right of "Take an Atheist to Church."  Descend via 2-bolt anchor on ledge.

content.description:
Wander up the slabby buttress left of "Easy Like Sunday Morning" following the path of least resistance/most protection.  A test piece for the 5.6 leader.

Direct variations go at harder grades (5.9 or so) but do not protect well and are probably best reserved for top roping.
content.protection: Nothing larger than #1 camalot needed, extra small gear.  Protection requires a keen eye and a bit of creativity but is generally adequate.
content.location: The slabby buttress sandwiched between "Sunday School" and "Easy Like Sunday Morning."  Descend via 2-bolt anchor atop "Sunday School," being wary of cactus as you step left to the anchor.

content.description: A few steep moves lead to a slabby left-facing corner. Follow the corner to a steep headwall. Ascend headwall through weakness on the right and head up left to 2-bolt anchor. The line is a dirty and vegetated.
content.protection: Single set of cams to #3 camalot, stoppers, plenty of runners to avoid rope drag as the corner arches.
content.location: Shares start with "Thank God It's Monday."  Descend via 2-bolt anchor shared with "Easter Sunday."

content.description:
I don't roll on Shabbos, so I'll climb on Sunday.

Fun TR up the middle of the scoop that can be set up after leading "Thank God It's Monday" or "Bloody Sunday."

The climbing through the scoop ends on the upper right side of the scoop (at least with my beta), which makes it possible to then bail over to Bloody Sunday, but it is probably more fun to crank up and left pulling a mantle and finishing the easy slab to the anchors.

May add some bolts in the future.

Scramble easy terrain to obvious gulley.  Straightforward climbing and protection make for a great beginner lead.  Very easy climbing leads to one well-protected 5.5 move at the top of the gulley to attain the ledge.

Belay at gear anchor in horizontal crack.  Step left across ledge a few feet to 2-bolt anchor on "Sunday School" to descend.  Beware of cactus on the ledge.
content.protection: Single set to #3 camalot and stoppers.  A hand-sized piece protects the upper crux move.
content.location: Start below the obvious gulley right of "Slabbath."  Descend via 2-bolt anchor atop "Sunday School" to climber's left a few feet across the ledge (beware of cactus!)

content.description: Follow easy cracks to varnished slab.  At top of slab, step left around headwall, then back up right to 2-bolt anchor.  The longest route on the Sunday Wall.
content.protection:
Single set to #3 camalot including small gear, stoppers, and a few long runners.

The climbing is easy, but a new leader may feel slightly run-out.  There is ample protection to be had, but small gear is required to protect the varnished slab.
content.location: Start at short crack beneath varnished slab right of "Easy Like Sunday Morning" gulley.  Descend via 2-bolt anchor shared with "Ritualistically Unclean."

climbs.name: Darkness on the Edge of Town

content.description:
Aka: Cold Sunday in Hell

Scramble up a short pillar of blocks just below a roof. Skirt around the roof on the face to the right on large feet (or go straight up into the roof at a more stout grade).  Continue to follow the corner to the bolts, passing a very old stamped piton.
content.protection: Single rack to #3 and a set of nuts (plenty of good stopper placements), a couple slings and some draws. An optional #4 can be used to protect the opening roof but a #3 is adequate if deeply buried.
content.location:
This is the rightmost route on the Sunday Wall, located just left of the bolted lines and fixed cable that mark the left end of Asbury Park.  It ascends an obvious, left-facing corner with a roof about 15 feet up.

Descend from bolted anchors at the top of the route.

content.description: Start on steep moves in a shallow left-facing corner.  Follow the corner up to a varnished slab and step left into a large crack through the overhang.  Continue to follow the crack onto lower-angle terrain to the 2-bolt anchor. One of the best routes on the Sunday Wall.
content.protection: Single rack to #3 camalot and stoppers will suffice.
content.location: This route begins just left of "Cold Sunday in Hell" at a steep, left facing corner.  Descend via a 2-bolt anchor shared with "Thank God It's Monday."
